There have been plenty of times at a store when we decided against something only after examining it and touching it, etc. This is exactly why some people never make a purchase online because they don't get to examine the product they're buying, they don't have it in their hands to feel it before actually buying it. We really have no idea how pervasive this issue is, but we do not fairly well that it exists. But still we would not worry about that only because there are so many other potential customers. What you need to do is have things in place at your site that serve to allay fears and build trust with your visitors.

Be very careful about choosing a product that you think will appeal to everybody because those products can often backfire on any market. The more special you can convincingly make people feel, the better they will feel about your particular offer. The more you take away from that exclusive and special feeling, the more you are flirting with losing the sale. You can offer exclusive bonuses that no one else will get, and that is just one work-around you can do. You no doubt have seen emails in which the sender stacks on heaps of bonuses if you order through his link - that is adding value and making the offer unique. People on the net hate being inconvenienced, just as you and I do, and so be sure you keep it like that with your ordering process.

If you can create some legitimate sense of urgency, then you should go ahead and do that. The thing about many of these psychological appeal devices is they can backfire on you only if you go overboard with them or just plain do it badly. How you approach your own situation is obviously up to you, and you have to maybe get creative with your own urgency devices. A time sensitive offer can be effective, but you have to follow through and end it at the specified time. Eliminate the reason to say no by creating a sense of urgency and give your prospects a logical reason to make the purchase now.

This goes back to human nature and learning what are essentially the tools of the copywriting trade to touch the heart and mind of the prospect.
